review.title: HISTORICAL REVIEW
review.paragraph1: The Rumiñahui canton originally formed part of the Metropolitan District of Quito and was considered a parish.
review.paragraph2: However, on May 31, 1938, General Alberto Enríquez Gallo elevated the parish of Sangolquí to the category of an autonomous canton.
review.paragraph3: Its name honors the Indigenous hero Rumiñahui, a symbol of courage for all Ecuadorians.
review.paragraph4: A group of citizens formed a civic board that promoted the creation of the Rumiñahui canton. Thanks to their efforts, both men and women of Sangolquí and its surroundings achieved cantonization 87 years ago.

elements.rumiñahui: Face of stone, an emblematic figure remembered for his historical deeds.

monuments.title: MAIN MONUMENTS
monuments.paragraph1: Its body displays multicolored tones: green reflects the constant renewal of nature; black represents the earth; yellow, orange, and gold symbolize the energy of the sun; crimson evokes struggle, effort, and blood; and dark blue expresses energy and health.
monuments.paragraph2: Endara Crown captured in this monument the golden 'food of the gods' through the naïve technique, recalling the fertility of the Valley of Los Chillos.
monuments.paragraph3: The work represents a farmer who, during his rest, looks for water but seems unable to find it, symbolizing effort and need.
monuments.paragraph4: A central monolith that functions as a solar clock and pays tribute to ancestral traditions related to agricultural cycles, representing solstices and equinoxes.

data.ubi: The parish of Cotogchoa is located in the southwestern part of the Rumiñahui canton.

data.ubi: The rural parish of Rumipamba is located in the Rumiñahui canton, Pichincha province, 15 kilometers from the city of Sangolquí.

data.ubi: It is located in the Rumiñahui canton, Pichincha province, in the Valley of Los Chillos, about 34 km southeast of Quito.

meals.name: LOCRO DE PAPA
meals.description: Traditional Andean soup prepared with potatoes, cheese, and avocado.

meals.name: YAHUARLOCRO
meals.description: Soup made with sheep offal, onion, and spices.

meals.name: ROAST GUINEA PIG
meals.description: Guinea pig roasted in oven or charcoal, served with potatoes and salad.

meals.name: FRITADA
meals.description: Pork cooked in its own fat, served with mote and toasted corn.

meals.name: HORNADO
meals.description: Oven-roasted pork, traditional in festivities and community gatherings.

meals.name: COUNTRY CHICKEN BROTH
meals.description: Broth prepared with free-range chicken and vegetables.

meals.name: MOTE WITH PORK CRACKLING
meals.description: Mote served with crispy pork crackling.

meals.name: EMPANADAS DE VIENTO
meals.description: Fried empanadas filled with cheese, sprinkled with sugar.
